Code

Here are some of my open-source projects and interactive demos. You may find more on my GitHub profile.

Interactive Demos & Tools

Neural Network Visualizer

An interactive, browser-based tool for visualizing neural network architectures. Create publication-ready diagrams for MLPs and ResNets.

Live Demo GitHub

BibTeX Merger

Python tool to merge multiple .bib files into a single bibliography without losing citation keys (e.g., when preparing a thesis).

GitHub

ReLU Neural ODE Point Simulator

Interactive demo for simulating the evolution of point clouds under a piecewise-constant perceptron field.

Live Demo GitHub

ReLU Flow Simulator

Interactive visualization tool to simulate density evolution under a piecewise-constant perceptron field.

Live Demo GitHub

Research Code

Perceptrons and Attention Landscape Localization

Simulation framework for the mean-field dynamics of Transformers as interacting particle systems on the unit sphere.

GitHub Paper

Continuous-time Distribution Modeling for Digital Health

Optimization of a time-dependent Gaussian mixture using MMD fitting for means/covariances + neural ODEs for the weights evolution.

GitHub Paper

Gaussian Mixture Optimization

Comparison framework for evaluating different loss functions (KL, L1, L2) in gradient descent optimization of mixtures.

GitHub

Neural ODE Classification Capacity

Classification as linear separability of two classes for pure noise data, to assess the expressivity of neural ODEs.

GitHub Paper

If you use any of these tools in your research or teaching, please cite the relevant papers mentioned above. Full citations are available in Papers.
